“I came here without reckoning on it,” Svidrigaïlov said. 

Raskolnikov frowned. “Where did you see me this morning?”

“I saw you by chance. There’s something about you like me.”

Raskolnikov shifted uneasily. “Are you starting soon on your travels?”

“What travels?” Svidrigaïlov laughed. “Perhaps I’ll get married instead.”

“Here?” 

“Yes. I want to see Avdotya Romanovna.”

“Why?”

“I earnestly beg it. Oh, tell your sister Marfa Petrovna remembered her in her will.” 

Raskolnikov stared, stunned.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov informs Raskolnikov that Marfa Petrovna left money for Avdotya Romanovna in her will.
